Irisbond Duo API

 Stop the API: Stop the eye tracker and the processing loop.
 
User positioning
void showPositioningWindow ()
 Show a fullscreen window that helps the user know the optimal location for the best tracking experience. It can be closed by clicking/tapping of by calling hidePositioningWindow()
 
void hidePositioningWindow ()
 Close the positioning window.

 Configure the calibration GUI displaying the walking duck animation.
 
bool loadTargetAnimationSpriteSheet (const char *pathToAnimation, int frames, float loopTime)
 Load a .png animation sprite sheet to be shown as the target (frames in horizontal). More...
 
void startCalibration (int numCalibPoints)
 Start a calibration process to adapt the eye tracker to the user's eyes. waitForCalibrationToEnd() must be called immediately after this function. More...
 
void cancelCalibration ()
 Cancel the calibration process.
 
void startImproveCalibration ()
 Start a 3-point calibration rectification to improve the worst 3 calibration points in a 5, 9 or 16-point calibration. waitForCalibrationToEnd() must be called immediately after this function.
 
void startCalibrationRectification ()
 Start a 1-point calibration rectification to improve the calibration waitForCalibrationToEnd() must be called immediately after this function.
 
CALIBRATION_STATUS waitForCalibrationToEnd (int timeoutInMinutes)
 Wait during the calibration processes until they finish. More...
 
void showCalibrationGUI (bool show)
 Enable or disable the API calibration GUI. More...
 
void showCalibrationPointErrorGUI (bool show)
 Enable or disable the API calibration error GUI when the user detection fails. More...
 
void showCalibrationResultsGUI (bool show)
 Enable or disable the API results GUI when the calibration ends. More...
 
void setStepByStepCalibration (bool step)
 Enable or disable the step-by-step calibration mode. More...
 
void resumeCalibration ()
 Start recording on a paused fixed point on step-by-step calibration mode. Then, it will automatically advance to the next point.
 
const char * getDefaultCalibrationChar ()
 Get default calibration string for your screen. More...
 
const char * getCalibrationChar ()
 Get current calibration string. If no calibration has been performed, the default one will be returned. More...
 
void loadCalibrationChar (char *calibrationChar)
 Load a calibration string to the system. Current calibration will be overwritten.
 
void loadDefaultCalibrationChar ()
 Restore the default calibration, optimized for the current screen size.

Detailed Description

\IrisbondAPI

http://www.irisbond.com

Typedef Documentation

◆ BLINK_CALLBACK

typedef void(* IrisbondAPI::BLINK_CALLBACK) (int mouseX, int mouseY, int screenWidth, int screenHeight)

Function to be called during the calibration when a blink is done by the user.

Parameters
mouseXX coordinate of the blink event. In pixels.
mouseYY coordinate of the blink event. In pixels.
screenWidthScreen width considered by the API to locate the target. In pixels.
screenHeightScreen heigth considered by the API to locate the target. In pixels.

◆ CALIBRATION_POINT_ERROR_CALLBACK

typedef bool(* IrisbondAPI::CALIBRATION_POINT_ERROR_CALLBACK) ()

Function to be called during the calibration when the user is not detected in one calibration point and decide to retry that point or cancel calibration.

Returns
True to try again, false to cancel calibration

◆ CALIBRATION_RESULTS_CALLBACK

typedef void(* IrisbondAPI::CALIBRATION_RESULTS_CALLBACK) (const double leftPrecisionError, const double leftAccuracyError, const double rightPrecisionError, const double rightAccuracyError, const double combinedPrecisionError, const double combinedAccuracyError, bool cancelled)

Function to be called when the calibration finishes, and the global calibration results are received.

Parameters
leftPrecisionErrorLeft eye precision, in pixels
leftAccuracyErrorLeft eye accuracy, in pixels
rightPrecisionErrorRight eye precision, in pixels
rightAccuracyErrorRight eye accuracy, in pixels
combinedPrecisionErrorBoth eyes precision, in pixels
combinedAccuracyErrorBoth eyes accuracy, in pixels
cancelledTrue when the calibration is cancelled. Results must be ignored when cancelled is true.

◆ CALIBRATION_RESULTS_POINTS_CALLBACK

typedef void(* IrisbondAPI::CALIBRATION_RESULTS_POINTS_CALLBACK) (int nPoints, double *xCoords, double *yCoords, double *leftErrorsPx, double *rightErrorsPx, double *combinedErrorsPx, double *leftErrorsNorm, double *rightErrorsNorm, double *combinedErrorsNorm)

Function to be called when the calibration finishes, and the detailed calibration results (point by point) are received.

Parameters
nPointsThe number of calibration points
xCoordsA vector with the X coordinates of the calibration points. Normalized between 0 (left of the screen) and 1 (right of the screen)
yCoordsA vector with the Y coordinates of the calibration points. Normalized between 0 (top of the screen) and 1 (bottom of the screen)
leftErrorsPxA vector with the left eye errors for all the points. In pixels.
rightErrorsPxA vector with the right eye errors for all the points. In pixels.
combinedErrorsPxA vector with the combined eye errors for all the points. In pixels.
leftErrorsNormA vector with the left eye errors for all the points. Normalized between 0 (perfect point) and 1 (should be improved)
rightErrorsNormA vector with the right eye errors for all the points. Normalized between 0 (perfect point) and 1 (should be improved)
combinedErrorsNormA vector with the combined eye errors for all the points. Normalized between 0 (perfect point) and 1 (should be improved)

◆ CALIBRATION_TARGET_CALLBACK

typedef void(* IrisbondAPI::CALIBRATION_TARGET_CALLBACK) (double pointX, double pointY, int screenWidth, int screenHeight, bool fixated)

Function to be called during the calibration to know the calibration target position and state.

Parameters
pointXX coordinate of the target. In pixels.
pointYY coordinate of the target. In pixels.
screenWidthScreen width considered by the API to locate the target. In pixels.
screenHeightScreen heigth considered by the API to locate the target. In pixels.
fixatedTrue when the target is fixated in the point (pointX, pointY), false when it is travelling towards that point.

◆ DATA_CALLBACK

typedef void(* IrisbondAPI::DATA_CALLBACK) (long long timestamp, float mouseX, float mouseY, float mouseRawX, float mouseRawY, int screenWidth, int screenHeight, bool leftEyeDetected, bool rightEyeDetected, int imageWidth, int imageHeight, float leftEyeX, float leftEyeY, float leftEyeSize, float rightEyeX, float rightEyeY, float rightEyeSize, float distanceFactor)

Function to be called when a new image is processed and a new gaze point is received.

Parameters
timestampThe timestamp that identifies the current gaze point. In milliseconds, from epoch.
mouseXX coordinate of the gaze point. In pixels, where 0 is the left side of the image.
mouseYY coordinate of the gaze point. In pixels, where 0 is the top of the image.
mouseRawXX coordinate of the raw gaze point, this means, without any filtering. In pixels. For research only.
mouseRawYY coordinate of the raw gaze point, this means, without any filtering. In pixels. For research only.
screenWidthScreen width considered by the API to estimate the gaze point. In pixels.
screenHeightScreen height considered by the API to estimate the gaze point. In pixels.
leftEyeDetectedTrue when the left eye is detected in the current gaze point. False when it is not.
rightEyeDetectedTrue when the right eye is detected in the current gaze point. False when it is not.
imageWidthCamera image width. In pixels.
imageHeightCamera image height. In pixels.
leftEyeXX coordinate of the left eye in the camera image. Normalized between 0 and 1, where 0 is the left side of the image, and 1 is the right side.
leftEyeYY coordinate of the left eye in the camera image. Normalized between 0 and 1, where 0 is the top of the image, and 1 is the bottom side.
leftEyeSizeLeft eye pupil size. In pixels.
rightEyeXX coordinate of the right eye in the camera image. Normalized between 0 and 1, where 0 is the left side of the image, and 1 is the right side.
rightEyeYY coordinate of the right eye in the camera image. Normalized between 0 and 1, where 0 is the top of the image, and 1 is the bottom side.
rightEyeSizeRight eye pupil size. In pixels.
distanceFactorTells the distance between the eye tracker and the user. Between -1 and 1, where -1 means too far, 1 is too close, and 0 is the ideal distance. Recommended [-0.5, 0.5]

◆ DWELL_CALLBACK

typedef void(* IrisbondAPI::DWELL_CALLBACK) (int mouseX, int mouseY, int screenWidth, int screenHeight)

Function to be called during the calibration when a dwell is done by the user.

Parameters
mouseXX coordinate of the dwell event. In pixels.
mouseYY coordinate of the dwell event. In pixels.
screenWidthScreen width considered by the API to locate the target. In pixels.
screenHeightScreen heigth considered by the API to locate the target. In pixels.

◆ IMAGE_CALLBACK

typedef void(* IrisbondAPI::IMAGE_CALLBACK) (char *data, int rows, int cols, int channels, long long timestamp)

Function to be called during the calibration when a new frame is acquired from the camera and the image is received.

Parameters
dataA pointer to the image raw data
rowsThe number of rows in the image
colsThe number of columns in the image
channelsThe number of channels in the image. Typically 1.
timestampThe timestamp that identifies the current gaze point. In milliseconds, from epoch.

Enumeration Type Documentation

◆ CALIBRATION_STATUS

enum IrisbondAPI::CALIBRATION_STATUS
strong

Result of the calibration process returned by waitForCalibrationToEnd()

Enumerator
CALIBRATION_TIMEOUT 

The calibration has not finished but the timeout is reached.

CALIBRATION_ENDED_ALT_F4 

The calibration is cancelled by the user with Alt+F4.

CALIBRATION_ENDED_ESCAPE 

The calibration is cancelled by the user with Esc key.

CALIBRATION_FINISHED 

The calibration has finished.

CALIBRATION_CANCELLED 

The calibration is cancelled programmatically.

CALIBRATION_FAILED_NO_CAMERA 

The calibration has found a camera error.

◆ CONTROLLING_EYE

enum IrisbondAPI::CONTROLLING_EYE
strong

Eye codification used by setUserEyeControlMode()

Enumerator
CONTROL_LEFT 

Only the left eye is required.

CONTROL_RIGHT 

Only the right eye is required.

CONTROL_ANY 

One eye is required, any of them.

CONTROL_BOTH_ALWAYS 

Both eyes are required.

◆ START_STATUS

enum IrisbondAPI::START_STATUS
strong

Result of the API initialization returned by start()

Enumerator
START_OK 

The API starts properly.

NO_CAMERA 

The camera is not detected on the computer. It can be not connected or the drivers are missing.

CAMERA_IN_USE 

The camera is being used by other program and the API can't access it.

CAMERA_ERROR 

The camera is connected but can't start because of a different reason.

QT_GUI_ERROR 

Deprecated, the API is not based on Qt anymore.

INVALID_LICENSE 

Deprecated.

Function Documentation

◆ areLedLightsOn()

bool IrisbondAPI::areLedLightsOn ( )

Check the eye tracker leds status.

Returns
True when the leds are on, false when the leds are off.

◆ getCalibrationChar()

const char* IrisbondAPI::getCalibrationChar ( )

Get current calibration string. If no calibration has been performed, the default one will be returned.

Returns
a pointer to the first character of the string.

◆ getCameraFocusDistance()

int IrisbondAPI::getCameraFocusDistance ( )

Get the eye tracker focus distance in centimeters.

Returns
the optimal distance between the tracker and the user for the best experience

◆ getCameraKeyword()

const char* IrisbondAPI::getCameraKeyword ( )

Get the eye tracker model. This ID is common for all eye trackers of the same type (i.e. Primma, Duo). This is only required for troubleshooting.

Returns
the hardware model

◆ getDefaultCalibrationChar()

const char* IrisbondAPI::getDefaultCalibrationChar ( )

Get default calibration string for your screen.

Returns
a pointer to the first character of the string.

◆ getHardwareNumber()

const char* IrisbondAPI::getHardwareNumber ( )

Get the eye tracker serial number in the format IRIS12345678. This ID is unique for each eye tracker.

Returns
the hardware serial number

◆ isApplicationEnded()

bool IrisbondAPI::isApplicationEnded ( )

Check that the API ends after calling stop()

Returns
True when the API stops properly. False when the API is still stopping.

◆ isHighPerformanceMode()

bool IrisbondAPI::isHighPerformanceMode ( )

Get the tracker high performance status.

Returns
True when the API is in high performance mode. False when it is not.

◆ loadTargetAnimationSpriteSheet()

bool IrisbondAPI::loadTargetAnimationSpriteSheet ( const char *  pathToAnimation,
int  frames,
float  loopTime 
)

Load a .png animation sprite sheet to be shown as the target (frames in horizontal).

Parameters
[in]pathToAnimationAbsolut path to the image. Please, when refering to paths, avoid using single backslashes ("\") as they will be intepreted as special characters. You can use both double back slashes ("\\") or forward slashes ("/") instead.
[in]framesTotal number of frames.
[in]loopTimeThe time it should take the animation to complete a loop in seconds.
Returns
true if the sprite sheet have been loaded successfully. False if not.

◆ loadTargetImage()

bool IrisbondAPI::loadTargetImage ( const char *  pathToImage)

Load a .png image to be shown as the target.

Parameters
[in]pathToImageAbsolut path to the image. Please, when refering to paths, avoid using single backslashes ("\") as they will be intepreted as special characters. You can use both double back slashes ("\\") or forward slashes ("/") instead.
Returns
true if the image have been loaded successfully. False if not.

◆ setBlinkCallback()

void IrisbondAPI::setBlinkCallback ( BLINK_CALLBACK  theCallback)

Set the callback to be called when a blink is done by the user.

Parameters
[in]theCallbackThe pointer to the function to be executed

◆ setBlinkConfiguration()

void IrisbondAPI::setBlinkConfiguration ( double  singleTime,
double  cancelTime,
bool  bothEyesRequired 
)

Configure the blink detector. A blink is detected when one or two eyes are closed in a time interval defined between a minimmum and a maximum blink times.

Parameters
[in]singleTimeThe minimum time to be considered a blink. In seconds. Default value is 0.3s.
[in]cancelTimeThe maximum time to be considered a blink. In seconds. Default value is 1.0s.
[in]bothEyesRequiredTrue when the blink must be done by the two eyes at the same time. False when only one eye is enough. False by default.

◆ setCalibrationCancelledCallback()

void IrisbondAPI::setCalibrationCancelledCallback ( CALIBRATION_CANCELLED_CALLBACK  theCallback)

Set the callback to be called when the calibration is cancelled.

Parameters
[in]theCallbackThe pointer to the function to be executed

◆ setCalibrationColors()

void IrisbondAPI::setCalibrationColors ( uint32_t  targetColor,
uint32_t  backgroundColor 
)

Configure the calibration GUI colors.

Parameters
[in]targetColorThe color of the target in 32 bit unsigned integer format (uint32_t), RGBA channels.
[in]backgroundColorThe color of the background in 32 bit unsigned integer format (uint32_t), RGBA channels.

◆ setCalibrationParameters()

void IrisbondAPI::setCalibrationParameters ( double  travelTime,
double  fixationTime 
)

Configure the calibration target travel and fixation time.

Parameters
[in]travelTimeTime that takes the target to go from one calibration point to another one. In seconds. Default value is 2s
[in]fixationTimeTime that takes the target to stay fixed in one calibration point. In seconds. Default value is 1s

◆ setDwellConfiguration()

void IrisbondAPI::setDwellConfiguration ( int  areaPixels,
double  time,
bool  bothEyesRequired 
)

Configure the dwell detector. A dwell is detected when the mouse is located within an area for a specific time.

Parameters
[in]areaPixelsThe distance the mouse can move within a fixation. In pixels. Default value is 30px.
[in]timeThe minumum time to be considered a fixation. In seconds. Default value is 1.0s.
[in]bothEyesRequiredTrue when the dwell must be done by the two eyes at the same time. False when only one eye is enough. False by default.

◆ setHighPerformanceMode()

void IrisbondAPI::setHighPerformanceMode ( bool  enable)

Configure the tracker to run in high performance mode.

Parameters
[in]enableTrue to activate high performance mode, false to disable it. True by default

void IrisbondAPI::setImageCallback ( IMAGE_CALLBACK  theCallback)

Parameters
[in]theCallbackThe pointer to the function to be executed

◆ setLicense()

void IrisbondAPI::setLicense ( const char *  license)

Set the license code when the license system is not based on an activation file.

Parameters
[in]licenselicense code

◆ setLocalTargetImage()

void IrisbondAPI::setLocalTargetImage ( int  index)

Configure the calibration GUI changing the image that will be shown as the target.

Parameters
[in]indexIndex of the image: "0 = Android icon"

◆ setSmoothValue()

void IrisbondAPI::setSmoothValue ( int  smooth)

Configure the smoothness of the mouse cursor. Low smoothing implies high speed, and viceversa.

Parameters
[in]smoothSmoothing amount. Can take values between 0 and 14, where 0 means a fast mouse, and 14 a very slow but steady mouse. Default value is 2.

◆ setStepByStepCalibration()

void IrisbondAPI::setStepByStepCalibration ( bool  step)

Enable or disable the step-by-step calibration mode.

Parameters
[in]stepTrue when you want to perform step-by-step calibration, false when you want a calibration without any pause. False by default.

◆ setTargetSize()

void IrisbondAPI::setTargetSize ( int  targetSize)

Configure the calibration GUI target size.

Parameters
[in]targetSizeThe size of the target from 1 to 100. 25 is equivalent to 3% of the height of the screen.

◆ setUserEyeControlMode()

bool IrisbondAPI::setUserEyeControlMode ( CONTROLLING_EYE  controlMode)

Configure the eye(s) to be taken into account for the eye tracker. It can be either eyes or both.

Parameters
[in]controlModeThe controlling eye in CONTROLLING_EYE format. Default value is CONTROLLING_EYE::CONTROL_ANY.
Returns
Deprecated, always true.

◆ showCalibrationGUI()

void IrisbondAPI::showCalibrationGUI ( bool  show)

Enable or disable the API calibration GUI.

Parameters
[in]showTrue when you want to show the API calibration GUI, false when you want to show your own calibration GUI. False by default.

◆ showCalibrationPointErrorGUI()

void IrisbondAPI::showCalibrationPointErrorGUI ( bool  show)

Enable or disable the API calibration error GUI when the user detection fails.

Parameters
[in]showTrue when you want to show the API error GUI, false when you want to show your own error GUI. False by default.

◆ showCalibrationResultsGUI()

void IrisbondAPI::showCalibrationResultsGUI ( bool  show)

Enable or disable the API results GUI when the calibration ends.

Parameters
[in]showTrue when you want to show the API results GUI, false when you want to show your own results GUI. False by default.

◆ start()

START_STATUS IrisbondAPI::start ( )

Start the API: Start the eye tracker and the processing loop.

Returns
START_STATUS code that tells whether start process is correct or there is some error

◆ startCalibration()

void IrisbondAPI::startCalibration ( int  numCalibPoints)

Start a calibration process to adapt the eye tracker to the user's eyes. waitForCalibrationToEnd() must be called immediately after this function.

Parameters
[in]numCalibPointsNumber of calibration points. Can be 2, 3, 5, 9 or 16.

◆ switchOffLedLights()

bool IrisbondAPI::switchOffLedLights ( )

Switch off the eye tracker leds.

Returns
True when the action is done properly. False when it's not.

◆ switchOnLedLights()

bool IrisbondAPI::switchOnLedLights ( )

Switch on the eye tracker leds.

Returns
True when the action is done properly. False when it's not.

◆ trackerIsPresent()

bool IrisbondAPI::trackerIsPresent ( )

Check that there is an eye tracker connected to the computer.

Returns
True if the eye tracker is connected. False if the eye tracker is not connected or the drivers are not installed

◆ waitForCalibrationToEnd()

CALIBRATION_STATUS IrisbondAPI::waitForCalibrationToEnd ( int  timeoutInMinutes)

Wait during the calibration processes until they finish.

Parameters
[in]timeoutInMinutesTime to force the calibration process to end in case the user can't do it properly. In minutes.
Returns
CALIBRATION_STATUS Code to know the reason why the calibration ends
